p: Overall, it was evident that the EOs of both ecospecies had potent phytotoxic activity against the two tested weeds ( B. pilosa and D. aegyptium), while the EO of the Egyptian ecospecies was more effective, particularly on the weed D. aegyptium. Consistent with the present results, the EO from aboveground parts of Pulicaria somalensis has been reported to have a stronger allelopathic effect on D. aegyptium than B. pilosa [ 10]. This could be attributed to the genetic resistance of weeds [ 48].
